intro: Asplenidictyum, commonly known as the rock fern, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Polygonaceae. It is characterized by its upright, branched stems and small, often clustered flowers. The plants typically grow in rocky or gravelly soils, preferring sunny to partially shaded environments. Asplenidictyum species are native to regions in southern Africa, particularly South Africa. They are valued for their ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in challenging conditions.
